newsitem.title: MALAWI: Blantyre Hotels Ltd lists on Malawi bourse.
newsitem.headline: Blantyre Hotels Ltd lists on Malawi bourse.

text.p: Hotel group Blantyre Hotels Limited (BHL) listed on the Malawi Stock Exhange on Monday making it the second company to float on the small bourse, officials said on Tuesday.
BHL made its debut by issuing 2,993,792 ordinary shares at opening bid and offer prices of 820 tambala and 890 tambala.
The company, incorporated in 1946, owns two hotels in the commercial capital Blantyre. It has 140 shareholders and its majority shareholding is owned by Malawi's Mandala Ltd.
BHL was previously listed on the Zimbabwe Stock Exchange (ZSE) before it was delisted in the 1980s because its major shares were held in Malawi.
The company said in a pre-listing statement in September that it had posted after tax profits of 3.267 million kwacha ($213,700) in 1996, an increase of 66.2 percent compared to 1995.
BHL's net asset value per share in September was 2,450 tambala.
"The 1996 pre-tax earnings per share more than doubled from the prior year to 192 tambala compared to 89.9 tambala in 1995," the statement said.
BHL Chief Executive Roddy Sharp said the company's listing had been easy because it was not trying to raise any new money.
"A stock exchange listing provides BHL with the opportunity to raise additional capital in future, in the event that it wishes to expand," Sharp said.
